content: Hey @WG-triage meeting time :smile:
thank you for all the efforts, first of all would like to officially welcome @LeSeulArtichaut to the triage-team.

given that they are already involved with a few teams, they'll be mostly doing "ad hoc triage" on the weekends instead of a scheduled slot and will be helping me with the reports and reassignments if possible
looks like we don't have much on the agenda today, so let's start with some feedback, anyone has anything to update about the triage efforts in the last month?
Sorry for missing my last few slots - school has been starting to get ready to start
no worries
we discussed this last time as well but let's do this again, so we are now following the original schedule right/

namely:
monday - JohnCSimon
tues - JoelPalmer
wed - Alex Macleod
thurs - Elinvynia
fri - crlf0710
sat - Muirrum
sun - -
is everyone okay with this schedule or do you want to switch places for this month?
okay i'm assuming everyone is fine with that
I thought I was Thursday?
we switched you back temporarily and we were going back to the original schedule (sat) as planned
Ah right, ok
if you prefer Thursdays, not a problem
Saturdays work better now
ok. we'll stick the original schedule then (the one above)

moving on - the detailed reports are good and gives me enough insight into how the triage process is going on :smile: so if you want, feel free to put as much information in the reports it's not a concern for me :stuck_out_tongue:
anyone has anything to add for today?
i guess that's it for today then. Thanks for all the effort
the next meeting will be on 2020-10-07T18:00:00+02:00
Should we ignore MIR PRs during triage?
like which ones?
no, don't ignore them
in cases liek the pr i linked you earlier, the conflicts last week were in mir files and not in the codefiles
(there are few more confliicts since then which are in source but those came up yest i think)

which is why there was a "label changing game" going on because even though they were conflicts, the conflicts were in in mir files and the reviewer is fine reviewing them with those conflicts (these are special cases and mostly the author will suggest )
for those unaware, we are talking about https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/72632
oh I see it - *.mir instead of *.rs
yep
there are few .rs conflicts now though but don't worry
any other concerns?
then that's it for the meeting. Thanks everyone for attending :smile:
